content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"\s|-" => "_")
end
```
In this function, we use the `replace` method to replace any spaces or hyphens with underscores. We also convert the string to lower case and remove leading and trailing whitespaces using the `strip` method. The regular expression `r"\s|-"` matches any space (`\s`) or hyphen (`-`).
